RMLL 2016: The Security Track
4-6 July 2016 in Paris


"Because not only Unicorns deserve Free Software and Security"

No global RMLL this year ? True ! However, the Security Track will be held at Paris Mozilla office next July. Come and enjoy listening top OSS projects contributors, Security hackers or hacktivists speaking about Freedom and Security ! Free entrance (booking available 18th, May 10AM) and talks in English :-)

News :
  • Booking interface online on Wednesday 18th, May - 13 May 2016
  • The program is online - 06 April 2016

Follow us on Twitter

Contents

Conferences

Meet speakers coming to expose Free Software projects for Security purposes, Security topics in Free Software projects or open standards dealing with Security !

You don't see what we are talking about ? Have a look to previous editions contents and speakers !

Networking

Exchange experiences, set up new relationships with accessibles attendees and speakers coming from very various areas from hackitivists to professional security reversers or Free Software enthusiasts.

Moreover these exchanges will be done in a beautiful place and in a warm and open-minded ambiance :)

Timeline

What and when ?

Call For Paper start: 15th January 2016
Call For Paper end: 31th March 2016

Talks acceptance: 10th April 2016
Program publication: 15th April 2016

Registration open: 1st May 2016 we work hard for 15 May 2016, in May anyway
Event: 4-6 July 2016


Price: free entrance but registration is required because seats number is limited (100 seats).

Previous editions

Since 2000, RMLL (Rencontres Mondiales du Logiciel Libre a.k.a. Libre Software Meeting) is an open access, free as in free beer, annual conference about Free Software, hosted in a different town each year. It hosts multiple tracks (Education, Economy, Technical ...) about Free Software in order to set up bridges between communities.

In 2016, there is no global RMLL because no local Free Software User group volunteered.
But, we, the Security Track chairmen, have decided to organize nevertheless our track because ... we love to bring to you brillant speakers on Free Software and Security.

Just have a look on the previous editions and the speakers who came to speak at RMLL Security Track.


  • RMLL 2015

    Beauvais, France

    Speakers:
    Thomas Chopitea (DFIR), Fred Raynal (Quarkslab), Jean-Philippe Aumasson (aka Veorq), Xavier Mertens (aka xme), François Marier (Mozilla Firefox),...
    Interviews + slides
    Videos

  • RMLL 2014

    Montpellier, France

    Speakers:
    Ange Albertini (reverser), Netfilter dev team and leaders, Lunar (Tor), Stéphane Bortzmeyer (DNS), Eric Leblond (Suricata),...
    Interviews:
    Ange Albertini, Lunar, Ninon Eyrolles
    Slides
    Videos

  • RMLL 2013

    Brussels, Belgium

    Speakers:
    Werner Koch (GnuPG), Jonathan Clarke (Rudder), Peter Czanik (Syslog-NG), Alexandre Dulaunoy (CIRCL),...
    Interviews + slides
    Videos

  • RMLL 2012

    Geneva, Switzerland

    Speakers:
    Henri Doreau (Nmap), Paul Rascagnères (reverser), Clément Oudot (Lemondldap-ng),...
    Interviews + slides

Practical information & Contact

Where: Mozilla Offices in Paris
Address: 16-bis Boulevard Montmartre, Paris 75009, France
Metro: take line 8 or line 9, exit at station "Richelieu Drouot" or "Grands Boulevards"
